intro: Aspilia martii, commonly known as the African firethorn, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking, spiky, red-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is adapted to arid conditions and thrives in full sun. Aspilia martii is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
